title: Ticket #4452: Collector port not defined, will use default: 9618 localhost 127.0.0.1
description:
If the COLLECTOR_HOST is set to 127.0.0.1 or localhost, the master will log the message 

Collector port not defined, will use default: 9618

in the context 

Master restart (GRACEFUL) is watching /tmp/8.2-test/condor-8.2.1-x86_64_RedHat6-stripped/sbin/condor_master (mtime:1403893350)
Collector port not defined, will use default: 9618
Started DaemonCore process "/tmp/8.2-test/condor-8.2.1-x86_64_RedHat6-stripped/sbin/condor_collector", pid and pgroup = 24178
Waiting for /tmp/8.2-test/condor-8.2.1-x86_64_RedHat6-stripped/local.puffin/log/.collector_address to appear.

Oddly, the message does not appear if COLLECTOR_HOST is set to the machine's public IP address or hostname (128.105.14.138 and puffin.cs.wisc.edu).

Clearly one of the two code paths is wrong, although it's not clear which one it is. Either the message should always be printed (when a port is not specified) or never.

Possibly related: #4451: compare null hostnames in same_host COLLECTOR_HOST 127.0.0.1
check_ins: 2014-Oct-09 15:52   Check-in [41365]: (#4452) When scanning COLLECTOR_HOST to determine which port to starter the collector on, the master now assumes that the first 'localhost' entry is its collector (as opposed to ignoring it). (By Todd L Miller )
